notes.text:
Low and slow is key for caramelizing onions
Use good quality beef stock
Individual oven-safe bowls work best

steps.descr: Slowly caramelize onions in butter for 30-40 minutes

on_enter.say: Right, let's slowly caramelize these onions in butter. We want them to be beautifully golden and sweet. This will take about thirty to forty minutes, so be patient and let them work their magic.

steps.instructions: Slowly caramelize onions in butter for 30-40 minutes

on_enter.say: Now, let's sprinkle the flour over those lovely onions and give it a good stir. This will help thicken our soup beautifully.

steps.descr: Add wine and let it bubble

on_enter.say: Time to add the wine. Pour it in and let it bubble away, reducing slightly. You'll smell that wonderful aroma as the alcohol cooks off.

steps.instructions: Add wine and let it bubble

steps.descr: Pour in stock and thyme, simmer for 20 minutes

on_enter.say: Let's pour in the beef stock and add a sprig of fresh thyme. Now, we'll let it simmer gently for about twenty minutes to let all those flavors meld together.

steps.instructions: Pour in stock and thyme, simmer for 20 minutes

on_enter.say: While the soup is simmering, let's toast those slices of French bread until they're nice and crispy. They'll be perfect for soaking up the soup.

steps.descr: Ladle soup into bowls, top with bread and cheese

on_enter.say: Now, let's ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls, top each one with a slice of toasted bread, and sprinkle generously with grated Gruy√®re cheese.

steps.instructions: Ladle soup into bowls, top with bread and cheese

steps.descr: Grill until cheese is golden and bubbling

on_enter.say: Finally, let's pop those bowls under the grill until the cheese is golden and bubbling. Keep an eye on them so they don't burn. Enjoy your delicious French onion soup!

steps.instructions: Grill until cheese is golden and bubbling

recipe.title: French Onion Soup
recipe.description: Rich, comforting soup with caramelized onions and melted cheese
